text.__SUMMARY__: Delphinium brunonianum, common name musk larkspur,  is a species of larkspur belonging to the family Ranunculaceae.
text.Description: Delphinium brunonianum can reach a height of 10–25 centimetres (3.9–9.8 in). It has a strong musky smell (hence the common name). The leaves are palmately lobed, petiolate and alternate. This plant produces racemes with 5 - 10 blue to purple cup-shaped flowers. Tepals have slender white hairs on both sides and  spurs are short. They bloom from July to September.
text.Distribution: This species is native to Central Asia, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Tibet and the Himalaya.
text.Habitat: It can be found in stony mountain slopes and screes at elevation of 4,300–5,500 metres (14,100–18,000 ft) above sea level.

Hortipedia
Plants for a future
